name: Virupaksha Temple
description: The main center of pilgrimage at Hampi. Dedicated to Lord Shiva.
best_time: Early Morning (Sunrise around 6:30 AM) or Evening Aarti.
detailed_description: The Virupaksha Temple is the oldest shrine in Hampi, continuously functioning since the 7th century AD. It started as a small shrine and grew into a large complex under the Vijayanagara rulers. The 50-meter tall eastern gopuram dominates the skyline.

name: Vittala Temple
description: Famous for its Stone Chariot and musical pillars. An architectural masterpiece.
best_time: Late Afternoon (4:00 PM) for golden hour photography.
detailed_description: This temple is the high point of Vijayanagara art and architecture. The famous Stone Chariot, which has become the symbol of Karnataka Tourism, stands in the courtyard. The Ranga Mantapa features 56 musical pillars that produce different musical tones when tapped.

name: Elephant Stables

name: Lotus Mahal
description: A pleasant blend of Hindu and Islamic architectural styles.
